moves.1. e4: I started off as usual with kings pawn opening.
moves.2. Bc4: I follow up with my favorite c4...always looking to take on f-7 so the king can't castle to throw off my opponent.
moves.3. d3: I get ready trade to move my bishop to g5 to take his knight to weaken his king.
moves.3... Nc6: Looks like he's setting up a simple king's indian defense.
moves.4. Bg5: Again he doesn't know that I really want his knight in my pocket. I prepare to take.
moves.5. c3: I counter...and at the same time I prepare to move my queen to c2 for a second check on the king after the bishop checks him on f7.
moves.6. Bxf7+: Here is where I make my move and check his king to take him out of position and throw him off.
moves.7... Ke8: He brings his king back home.
moves.8. Qb5: This is where the noob comes out of me....There is no reason for this move. I was hoping to take the pawn on c5 at the same time checking his king but didn't see the defending knight...stupid I know!
moves.8... Be7: Looks like he's bringing out the bishop to protect his knight.
moves.9. Nf3: I bring out my knight in hopes to castle soon and protect the bishop and for center control.
moves.9... d6: He does what is expected and pushes up one of his pawns to d6
moves.10. d4: I push up my pawn for center control.
moves.10... exd4: He takes my pawn on d4
moves.12. Bxf6: Finally I take his knight! the move I have been waiting for. Maybe a bit too soon as I now see I could have moved my pawns up to protect the bishop?
moves.12... Bxf6: He retakes with bishop on f6
moves.13... Nxd4: He steals my pawn at the same time threatning my queen
moves.14. Qd5: b7 might have been a better move. What do you think?
moves.14... Nc2+: Another noob mistake. Forgetting to castle !!! and my king and rook being forked as I am checked.
moves.15. Ke2: Should have moved closer to the knight but didn't want my king out in the open.
moves.16. Qb3: I pretend to go for his knight but actually im staring down b7 which is the move i missed prior.
moves.16... Nxa1: He does the obvious and takes my rook.
moves.17. Qxb7: I take his pawn on b7
moves.17... dxe5: He pushes up his pawn to e5
moves.18. Nc3: I finally move my knight out because im low on pieces...I am actually down major at this point. How I win is beyond me.
moves.18... Nc2: He moves his knight to c2
moves.19. Rd1: I get my rook to an open file as I'm sure you will all appreciate
moves.19... Nd4+: He checks me with his knight.
moves.20... exd4: He takes my rook with his pawn.
moves.21. Nxd4: and I take back his pawn
moves.21... Rb8: He goes for my queen with his rook.
moves.22. Qxa7: I take his pawn on a7
moves.23. Kf1: I move my king once more.
moves.23... Rd2: Black casually moves his rook to d2 as he eyes down my knight with both his rook and his bishop. I have to move one of my knights..Which one?
moves.24. Nf5: I move one of my knights to f5. One of them has to be taken. I think I chose wisely.
moves.24... Bxc3: Looking at the board now...I am down -12 in material...and I only have 2 active pieces to his 5 active pieces...how did I do it? This is the good part !!!
moves.25. Qe3+: I check him with my queen at the same time getting ready to take his bishop.
moves.26. Qxc3: I take his bishop and now his rook is looking nice.
moves.27... Rd5: I don't think this was a good move by black to retreat his rook and go for my knight. a better move would be to check my again with his queen by going black queen to e8. Instead he moves his rook to d5.
moves.28. Qxg7+: You probably saw this coming. Its the move I was waiting on. I check his king at the same time his rook is threatened and I am protected by the knight on f5. At this point not much he can do but follow my lead.
moves.29. Qxh8+: I take his rook. Again checking him !
moves.30. Qxd8: now his queen is taken. and I am up in material. The tables have now turned that quickly. I think his best move here would be to check me or take my knight.
moves.30... Be6: He chose bishop to e7 to guard his rook.
moves.31. Qe7+: Again I check him and threaten his bishop.
moves.31... Kg6: He is setting himself up now but he has no choice.
moves.32. Qxe6+: At this point my opponent resigns as he will most likely be checkmated in on a couple moves. Thanks for viewing my game. hope you enjoyed it...again I am new to this game so please tell me how I did or what I could have done better. Thanks!!

gameName: Remarkable win by an improving player
